page.title: 01Knowesgate, Northumberland
page.content: knowsgate is the key pont for communications in this area. It is situated on a main route to Otterburn Range and Scotland. It has a motel with an adjacent garage and shop. The railway from Scotsgap to West Woodburn that served the Army and Forestry, hs been closed. A new land mark is three pronged propeller of electricity unit. The Ray Estaes belonged to Sir Charles Parsons, who had a country mansion at Ray. It ws demolished after the war. he is buried at Kirkwhelpington. Sheep are the most obvious products of the pasture, but some prefer grouse, which is profitable. The hills can be very attractive under the carpet of heather, but the climate is harsh.Blackhlls is the only farm in the area. The in bye land provides for cattle and a little cultivation,but sheep are predominant.
